description: Awesome dolsot and duk bok ki. Reasonable prices and quick service. One of my favorites in the inner sunset.
author: Roz J.

description: Good, quality, inexpensive, flavorful, simple food. We liked it. Daughter had a spicy seafood and tofu stew, I had a seafood dol sot bi bom bop. They were each around $10 and came out fast. I wasn't crazy about the seafood blend, the shrimp and seafood was miniscule..but the flavor was good. The veggies were pretty great that they brought out too. It seems a bit more authentic than Hahn's. It was probably closer to 3.5 stars if I had that option....small place though, prepare to wait or come early.
author: Faina G.

description:
I just spent a year in Korea so I was excited to see a place in the Inner Sunset serving Korean comfort food like pajeon and ddeokbokki. 

Unfortunately this was just not up to par. The jaeyuk bokkeum I ordered was thin, greasy, and sweet rather than thick and spicy. The kimchi jeon did not resemble anything I had in Korea. 

Overall the food had an amateur, inauthentic vibe to it. I'm guessing their cooks are not Korean and not particularly well-trained in preparing Korean food.
author: Joe S.

description: The smell when you walk in is amazing! The atmosphere is extremely pleasant and the employees are very obliging. The food was out quickly and tasted very good! Would recommend the bibimbap!
author: Madeline M.

description: The bibimbaps and kimchee pancakes were amazing.  The side dishes were really tasty, and they brought us more of it as soon as it was done.  Only annoyance is that I prefer being served cold water to hot tea (but you can just ask for water)
author: Jeff W.

description: Yes. Finally. Great Korean in the Inner Sunset.
author: Greg A.

description: Ate here last night...craving some chew so I went with the Duk Bok Ki. Smallish portion but price was nice at $6.99. Good level of heat. Banchan were just average, much prefer Han Il Kwan. Seafood Pancake was crispy, greasy and salty- all very good things in my mind. Place is small and poppin', so be prepared to wait. Service is most definitely friendly. Good little spot for an inexpensive bite when in the Sunset.
author: Anthony R.

description: I live just up the block from this place, and I got really excited when I heard that something was replacing that awful little bangkok thai place. Anyway, came to Manna for lunch on a Saturday. We had the kimchi soup and the spicy beef and green onion soup. Both were great, and the service was pleasant. Looking forward to coming back for more.
author: Todd H.

description: FINALLY...Inner Sunset gets a great Korean restaurant. Being 50% Korean and growing up on this stuff, I can proudly say Manna fits the bill and delivers excellent Korean food. Manna really compliments the other area neighborhood restaurants well and gives Irving St what it was missing. I know the neighbors of Inner Sunset will support and enjoy this newest addition.
author: Johnny L.

description: i'm korean. This place is owned by koreans. the kimchi and banchan keeps coming. they have dangjang chigae. it tastes like my mom's. 5 stars!
author: Jeff S.

description:
this place is aiiight. if you read my other korean restaurant reviews, you'll see that i love socal korean restaurants as that is where there is a high concentration of korean people and restaurants which means better quality due to high competition. in sf there arent a lot of good korean places as there are so few.

manna is ok. they're not bad but not amazing. the place itself is tiny so time your arrival correctly. my friend and i got here as a few groups were leaving so we got a table right away. the menu is simple and full of good stuff. the ban chan are kinda small, even the kimchi dish. that kind of surprised me as the kimchi dish is usually the biggest.

anyways i got the yook gae jang as that is one of my favorite dishes. the broth was tasty and the noodles were al dente and the beef was tender.

since its located in inner sunset, parking can be a problem so take pub trans if you can.
author: edward k.

description: Food is not good. Its very cheap and clean. Service is good. I tried 4 dishes, i didnt like all of them.
author: Jun I.

description:
Irving street patrons! Please support your local Korean spot and this is the place to go!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Yes, how ingenious to FINALLY have a little Korean spot, it took this area long enough! I can only give this place 4 stars because I have another Korean spot that is my loyal fave but....I will give you the pros and cons as I much as I can, unlike the whiny person that complained about the lack of side dishes.... 
Pros: This place has a menu that is comfort foods that goes well with their soju and beer selection as well as the palate of the demographics. It's simplified due to the selection of side dishes that are served. I'll tell you this though, it's a start up little spot, those side dishes are simply appetizers that wet the palate. Note, if you have an establishment that has been around for awhile, you will deliver more side dishes but for now, the owners are seeing what is popular and what is not with the patrons. Why waste money on side dishes that the patrons won't eat or like, simple economics and a smart one. 
Here's another reason why they don't serve that many side dishes (yet), their main dishes were made really well, like my grandmother made. The number 38 (dumpling soup) was as authentic as my grandmother's hugs and her own mandu soup. I wanted to cry because it tasted soooo amazing and definitely prepared with care. I also had the dolsot bibimbap, super hot so that I didn't get jipped by not having crunchy rice on the bottom like some places, it was a good amount with good accoutrement's and the egg and meat were just right. 
Look here, complainer who probably can't tell what is good and what isn't at a Korean restaurant and probably gets full from the side dishes thus he cannot tell if his main dish is actually fantastic, stop your crying and go somewhere else that's crappy. The service was on top of it, the owner was so super nice and accommodating, I asked if they had duk (thinly sliced rice cake) in the mandu guk and he said it wasn't on the menu but he added it anyways. Soooo good, and they REFILLED our several side dishes as we ate them with our main dish. I hope this place thrives and continues their quality of Korean food, they have all the things I love on their menu and I will be back to sample more! 

The wait, not long at all, and it was WAY SHORTER THEN NAMU, (I hated the wait at Namu, it's trendy and not worth the HOUR AND A HALF WAIT!!!!!, the food isn't spectacular)
The cons for this place, parking is a b-cth but it's worth it here.
author: Natasha C.

description:
Pros:
- reasonable prices for Korean restaurant
- friendly owner

Cons:
- the spicy pork had too much sauce.
- the short ribs were overcooked. The meat was too tough. 
- only four side dishes were included and the selection was poor compared to other Korean restaurants
- we had to ask for water several times then they don't give us ice with the water.
- tables were small.
- seats were uncomfortable.
- waitress was too busy chatting with co-workers

Would I come here again?
"Maybe if I was super desperate" is what my girlfriend said when I asked her before we left this restaurant.
author: Mike W.

description: Korean BBQ?!? sounds like a great idea. It's a small cozy restaurant with a waitress that was decently cute and polite.  They greeted promptly and the food arrived shortly after i ordered.  The food was good; had beef and assorted vegetables in a stonebowl. Wished they had put more beef in the bowl though; it had a lot of rice instead in it.  Also wished they would have a thing where you could cook like your own stuff but either way, this place was goooood.
author: Logan T.

description: Not impressed.  We came for lunch and ordered bibimbap and japchae, and found them both mediocre.  The broccoli banchan was wildly and irregularly salted, with a couple florets being stealth salt bombs.  The service and the tea were good, and the prices are low.  But I don't think we'll be back.
author: Julia S.

description: I had the bibimbap.  I'm not an expert in Korean Food, but I thought the food was good, the price was right, and the people were very nice.  I'd go back and try more things.
author: L. D.

description: The employees are so friendly and attentive.  The food's amazing, and the price is such a good deal! I wouldn't change a thing about this place!
author: Tina L.

description: Great place to stop after spending a day at the park and museums.  Great food and service.
author: kevin l.

description: It was good Korean Food !! Came here with friends it was quaint and quiet but pretty good! i did like it!!
author: Sophia W.

description: Since options for good Korean food are limited in San Francisco, I was so excited when Manna opened in my neighborhood.  I am fortunate to have tried much delicious Korean food in Santa Clara and Los Angeles.  Manna is not the best, but it is SOLID.  You will not have a bad meal here.  The tofu stew is satisfying and the seafood pancake is top notch.  Our family of four normally devours jap chae, bulgogi, dok bok ki, tofu stew, and a seafood pancake.  This hits the spot for Korean food cravings....
author: lucy w.

description:
This place is good! 

My third time here, and I usually order Seafood Dol-Sot Bibimbap. The food is really hot, good, and fresh. What caught my attention was the hot bowl. It's so cool!

Anyway, service is good, small cozy restaurant, and the atmosphere is great. 

I give this place 4 stars because the last time I went, it was eh...  I guess it was an off day for them? I don't know. I'll still come back, but if it's ehh again... hmmm

Try this place! You won't regret it!
author: K. P.

description: MMMMmmmmm this place rocks for standard Korean fare! I was worried I would have to wait for a while to get seated but I came here at about 6 on a Saturday for a table for two and sat down right away! Try the kimchi pancake, the chicken bbq, and the chop chae noodles. There is so much food!!! The staff is friendly too-- they stored my friend's cake in their fridge for her bday.
author: Patricia M.

description: Love this place. Bulgogi was excellent and right for the price of $10.95 plus side dishes of kimchi. Plus great and quick service. Only drawback is that it's cramped. It was definitely worth 2 miles walk from Hardly Strictly Bluegrass.
author: Dan L.

description: Welcome Manna to the Inner Sunset.  The restaurant is crowded at peak times so I'm excited about their to go menu.  I liked the food, the clean restaurant and the nice people that work there.  I'm not an expert on Korean, but I liked my rice dish and the portions.
author: Susan B.

description:
Worst. Service. Ever.

We got there around 7pm and put our names down for a table. Everyone who was there before us got seated. People who came in after us got seated. Finally after over half an hour my friend went to the waiter and asked about our table, letting him know we had been waiting since 7. The waiter procedes to argue with her, saying he doesn't believe her, and that we had never put our names on the list. He was so rude and dismissive and made no effort to accomodate us or apologize for the mix-up. Needless to say we were livid, and went to eat somewhere else.

I will NEVER patronize this place on principle, especially with so many other amazing korean restaurants in the city.
author: Kate K.

description: After watching bibimbap being made on a Dotch Cooking Show, I KNEW I had to try this dish.  Boy was I lucky that Manna offered this dish.  It is safe to say, because of Manna, that I LOVE bibimbap!  It looked exactly like the food in the episode.  And the TASTE!  Oh golly...the TASTE was incredible.  So many gorgeous textures and flavors...I really was in heaven.  On top of all that, the restaurant and service was impeccable.  It was an extremely nice and calm environment.  No fuss.  No fussy noises.  Straightforward skilled and splendid food.  I can't WAIT to go back to this gem!
author: Dee J.

description: Excellent Korean food near UCSF.
author: Mason I.

description: Watch out San tung , Manna's chicken wings might give you a run for your money
author: Sophia C.

description: Delicious, affordable and the staff is friendly.  I love that they will refill your rice bowl and condiments dishes without charging you extra for it.  We had 3 different servers and even the owner come by and ask if we'd like more rice.  I also like their selection of bimbimbaps.  It looked like everyone around me was ordering it and it looked really good.  I'm absolutely going to try one of them next time.  I had the Kalbi and it was so yummy.  The ribs weren't over cooked and the marinade had a nice sweetness to it.  My roomie had the spicy pork and tofu kimchee soup and it was also pleasing to the palate.  I would add this to my list of restaurants I would go to when I'm craving Korean food.  Great place for lunch or dinner.
author: Marita S.

description:
Great little restaurant! Lots of light with floor to ceiling windows on the corner of 8th and Irving. Food is tasty, hot, and comes out quickly. Also, the friendly waitstaff will refill your tea cups and banchan (side dishes) again and again. Even when the restaurant gets busy, they don't try to push you out the door by sweeping your dishes away and plunking down your check as soon as possible.

I brought my boyfriend to Manna tonight. He's not used to Korean food and chose something that ended up being too spicy for him (I ate some of it and thought it was delicious). Both waiters (maybe husband and wife owners?) were concerned that he wasn't eating much and asked if they could bring him something else. When the bill came, the waiter insisted on taking the meal off of the bill. What amazing customer service. Manna really lives up to its name. We'll definitely be back again.
author: K. D.

description: Finally some great Korean food in the inner Sunset at a great price. Get the chicken wings!!!! The best I have ever had.
author: Jared F.

description: I've eaten Korean foods at various places around town and love it.  So when Manna took over the old Bankok restaurant on the corner of 10th & Irving, I was eager to try it.  I got chop chae and a bi bim bap--and was disappointed with both because they were so bland, like the cook forgot to add some vital ingredient(s).  Maybe I went on a bad day or maybe it was right as the cook was going on a break and my order ruined it for him/her.  I'm not sure I'll go back since there are so many other places I need to try in this town.  The prices are good but that doesn't help if the food isn't up to par.
author: Kai T.

description:
i couldn't decide if i should give this place 5 star or 4 star.  

the only reason i would consider 5 star for this place is their side dishes.  They are the best I've tasted for the past 2-3 years.  Some side dishes in other Korean places taste "old."  But in Manna, you can actually taste the freshness in their side dishes.  to me, side dishes is just as important as the entrees.  

the only reason i would consider 4 star for this place is nothing has blown me away.  they are all good and fresh but nothing makes me dying to go back even though i will be back for sure.

we ordered seafood tofu soup and beef short ribs.  the tofu soup didn't taste fishy at all which to me is a big plus.  i've tasted too much fishy tofu soup in the past.  it seemed like everybody ordered beef short ribs and it is indeed a very good choice.

i have absolute no complaint about this place.  clean place, prompt service and fresh food.  i can't ask for more.
author: W C.

description: Loved it! I have never had Korean food before and I really loved the experience. The food was delicious, amazingly well priced, and spicy was real spicy. The portions are really big though, so start with just one.  Also I have to commend how friendly the staff was. It really created a nice and welcoming atmosphere.
author: Anastasiya A.

description: The place was very small and crowded. Crowded usually means a good sign but not in this case. The service was ok but not super attentive. The food was horrible. The fish soup was watered down and too salty. The fish stew had very little fish in it. The lobster-crawfish was uneatable.
author: Ben S.

description: I've eaten here three times, all with different people, and the general consensus is that it's a good place for a good price. I liked the dak bulgolgi (really tender, juicy, and falvorful), kinchi jaeyuk bokkum (tender, tasty, and very generous portion), and seafood pancake (fluffy and delicious). They're generous with their banchan, and the service is good at refilling them and that great rice tea. I didn't like the bulgolgi, japchae, or ddukbokki (too sweet).
author: Kim D.

description:
We loved Manna!  We were strolling around the Inner Sunset, looking for something that struck our fancy.  We were quite impressed that at 9pm on a Monday night, almost every table was full (lucky us, there was 1 more left).

Loved the traditional appetizers and dipping sauces.  We ordered fried dumplings, a spicy pork dish and a beef kimchee dish.  Perfect combo, complementary flavors.  

The service was warm and attentive; loved the family-owned vibe as well as the obviously satisfied customers in the house.  We'll be back!
author: carol d.

description: I love the fact this place was affordable for Korean food.  It's also in the city. It's not as good as Mom's Tofu house in South San Francisco, but this place is really good for its price.  I definitely suggest here if you want good Korean food for an affordable price. ^^
author: John H.

description: Small place, just nice. Long line sometimes, somehow hard to find parking. Great food, great banchan, try the tofu soup, arguably one of the best korean restaurants in the city.
author: Darren G.

description:
how do i give less stars for their quick, hot, fresh, decently-priced noms and such kind, smiling service?

i donut.

alright, all y'all probably know this already; manna don't serve no royal feasty korean food. the dishes are straightforward, basic, and yummy. on cold nights when your tongue craves kimchi and you don't want to wait forever for your food, come here. are the flavors spectacular? not mind-blowing, but indeed comforting and wholesome. the staff are always smiling, and service is super efficient, from my multiple experiences at this establishment.

kanpoongki (sweet and sour chicken waaangs), dol-sot bibimbap, dae ji bul kogi, seafood soft tofu soup (spiciest you make 'em, please), nakji bokum (chewy chew chew octopus) are my go-tos when i'm here. not a big beef eater, but the kal bi always look and smell hella good. i keep telling myself 'next time', but i already love the current faves. go for it though, they give you quite the amount of beefy beef beef.

the ban chans aren't out of this world, but they're nommy enough.

so okay, i would probably give manna 3.75 stars instead, but rounding it up to 4 because this place is too darn cute. people always be smiling away while they digging in and after they've eaten their fill. always a good sign.
author: Eliza D.

description: This used to be a Thai place that I never went to. Manna has been around for about 6 months now, and finally tried it last week with a group of people. We shared a bunch of dishes, but I'd say that standout(s) were the chicken wings. As others have said, super nice staff. Glad this place is here in the neighborhood, we were lacking a Korean place.
author: Ken L.

description: Good food and quick service. I went there a few times with my boyfriend when craving a heavy and greasy meal. I like their hot clay pots (I forget the actual name of it) and their portions are a good size to save some for leftovers. Writing this review is even making me hungry and craving Korean food. Check it out and I'm sure you will like it as well. :)
author: Magdalena Z.

description: Dolsot bibimbap was hot and sizzling. Pretty decent flavors in there ! The waitresses were extremely nice and was attentive despite it being the lunch rush.
author: K. M.

description:
delicious!

came down to the city for a little getaway, crashing our homies apartment in cole valley for the weekend while they are away.

been coming to this hood for a few years, always on the search for some new spots.  craving korean food, so looked up what was around and found Manna.  good score.

super kind folks running a tight little ship.  busy busy busy.  the place was filled to the brim, but we were doing take out, cause the little one was already crashed out for the night.  got the kal bi and the dol sot bibimbab.  all sooo good.  and great sides of kim chi and other pickled goodness.  loved it.  

if you are in the vicinity, get away from upper haight and head into inner sunset for some good grubbing!
author: Stu O.

description: Foods is OK but service is horrible. They don't know to to prioritize order they serve their own people first.
author: Ecinaj L.

description: Neighborhood gem!  Very yummy food, and plenty of options.  It's a bit small, so don't be surprised if there's a bit of a wait at peak hours.
author: Carrie A.

description: Not bad. I got the spicy tofu and seafood soup. It was definitely pretty flavorful, but not very spicy, even though I ordered it spicy. It was about $10 at lunch I think. The owner or manager or whatever was really nice and friendly. We came in as a group from work and he gave us the lunch prices even though he said that they do not offer those on holidays. Since we were working on Columbus Day, which shouldn't even be a celebrated day, he said he would five us the pricing. Everyone else seemed to really like their food as well. My coworker got the bibimbap, which he said was great. Another friend got a rice dish that she really liked. I think this is a pretty solid pick overall and left feeling very satisfied with my meal. Might make it back, but it depends how long I work here because there are just so many restaurants to try in the area.
author: Miguel V.

description: Great food, great people, great atmosphere.  Pretty good price too.  The only downside was that there wasn't any dessert!
author: Andrew S.

description:
not overpriced, not over portioned ( no surprise), not bad though...
you'd think a 9.99 or whatever lunch plate wouldn't be this good... but it is...
really good and it's clean and cozy inside..another good choice for when your in the 9th and irving area
author: Adam O.

description: Now I know why there is a line out the door when I drive by.  Wow! The food is really good....even when you take it to go!  I can't wait to come back to dine in!  We had the bibimbop and the wings.  The wings were awesome!
author: Stella C.

description: I was happy to finally find a Korean restaurant in the inner sunset area. This place is good thought! I had this dish of kimchi with pork and it was delicious and spicy how I like my food. The banchan was good too. I do have to say their standout is their seafood pancake I suggest you try that! I definitely will be going back to be trying more dishes especially with friends.
author: Nadia N.

description: Really good, it's not ideal for big groups because of the limited seating but the staff is super on it and the food was delicious. Additionally the manager kept casual conversation with guests and made great recommendations. That's how you know a place is legit, when it's owned and run by good, happy people :)
author: Rauf S.

description: Didn't this used to be a Thai Place? Whatevs...there's too many Thai places in SF already! My homegirl, who's half Korean, and I have been on the hunt for a bomb Korean place for a whilst now (Toyose DOES NOT cut it for real Korean food). I ordered the Korean BBQ (duh) and my friend ordered the soft tofu soup (medium spicy)...also got some pot stickers (perfectly cooked to my liking!). They give you the typical Korean small dishes with Anchovies, Kimchi, radish, sprouts, broccoli, and something else. Everything was tasty, clean, and hearty...exactly what we were looking for! The service was great too! Thanks for always refilling my yummy barley tea!
author: Adlyn S.

description: It's so great to have delicious Korean so close to home! Love the fried dumplings and the side veggies (forgetting the name right now) that come with entrees. Nice family run place and inexpensive delicious food!
author: C V.

description: Today I came in with my mom and my boyfriend. The waitresses were very nice and were very attentive. One thing I really loved about this restaurant was that it was very generous. They give you refills for rice and the side dishes; other Korean restaurants in San Francisco (that I've been to) have never offered this option. The food is not expensive at all and it definitely fills you up. I ordered #9 on the menu and it was delicious! It had rice, meat, and vegetables. You absolutely get your bang for your buck, but be sure to mix your rice around so it doesn't stick to the bowl! (It is a special bowl that keeps your food hot.) #5 was also a good choice (sweet and sour chicken).  Coming back again soon!
author: Terri H.

description: I've had better Korean. Smallish kalbi portion. Good ban chan (side dishes).
author: Inigo M.

description: great food, friendly staff! the place is small and cozy, not good for a group larger than 4 though! pancakes are great, and prices are VERY GOOD!
author: Laura D.

description: Best Korean food is in Oakland, but Manna is pretty good! Prices are reasonable.  I usually get the dol sot bimbimpbab or soft tofu stew and the chicken wings.  Side dishes are really good too.  I boycotted My Tofu House and come here instead.
author: A C.

description: Duk buk ki is delicious I came back twice for this and the bulgogi. Side dishes are good but what I love about this place is the SERVICE! They are nice friendly and recommend the right dishes for your taste buds! I will be coming back for sure
author: Kay H.

description:
I definitely agree with what a lot of other 4-star commenters have written (especially recent reviews by Holly G and Matthew L), so I won't go into "repeat mode".

I have ordered take-out from Manna at least once a week since they opened in the neighborhood.

The quality AND quantity of food for the price(s) that they offer definitely do not disappoint. Couple this with the fact that their owner, Young, and his wife are incredibly warm/friendly every time I walk in the place and Manna earns 5 stars on my list.

A welcome addition to the neighborhood - I hope they stay for a long time!
author: B. Earl K.

description: FINALLY a good korean spot on Irving. This place is really small so definitely not a good place for big groups to hang. The lunch specials are super cheap and definitely more than enough food. I've only been here once and had the bibimbap and japchae. Another plus, awesome service! I will be back.
author: Marilyn W.

description: Manna!!! I love this place , there are only a few korean restaurants in the sunset, but I think this might be the only one open during lunch time where you can eat-in at! The food here is cheaper than most korean places in SF and also very delicious! I came here to try the typical korean dishes such as tofu soup , bulgogi , kalbi , bibimbap , and all i can say is , it is all very delicious! You can decide how spicy your soup is when you order! I ordered medium spicy and it wasn't too spicy but it was really good when you pour it over rice! The bulgogi and kalbi here is also very delicious! the food is really fresh and authentic , you can tell they make it on the spot freshly! They also have really good tea here! Love this little place ! Only bad thing I can say is that..it is impossible to find parking here during lunch and dinner hour considering it is near 9th and irving. However if you get the chance , come here and enjoy really good authentic korean food!
author: Jeffrey T.

description: Pretty good food, bibimbap had less vegetables than I expected, but it was filling nonetheless. I would definitely return.
author: Jason C.

description: Fantastic food and very friendly service, it is worth the wait, just have a beer while you wait.   I drove in from Mill Valley and I will do it again many times, really good!!!
author: Maria v.

description: Super clean beautiful white interior for an inexpensive Korean place. I often come here for lunch. Sometimes I think it is great other times my rice can be a bit cold.  If you are a regular in this hood and want to mix up your eating out choices it is worth stopping in
author: Sean H.

description: The restaurant is so lovely and the dishes are unbelievable!!! It is so delicious. I had "shrimp bibimbap" .price is very cheap for delicious food.
author: Hulya Y.

description: Cute little restaurant. Came here by a recommendation. Staff is friendly and welcoming. Be prepared to wait- there's very limited seating.
author: Michelle G.

description: Wow, seriously nothing to complain about!  Service was great - owner man was SO NICE!  Place is a little bit small, so we had to wait for a bit.  however, proportions are perfect and the dishes are really affordable esp. for korean food.  I had the tofu soup which was really flavorful (too bad no egg though) and one of my friend's got the short rib with rice.  her plate came stacked high with meat, yum!  will definitely be going back, either to eat in or to get take out.  i hope this place is around for awhile!
author: Tiffany D.

description: I love the korean food they make here. esp the Jab Chae MMMM yumm even the noodle have favors, Kai Bi, To Fu Soup Kim Chi Fried Rice. Everything here is so traditional and have its original taste. would love to come back again soon!!!
author: Johnson C.

description: Happy to have a local spot serving decent korean food!  Dolsot bibimbap is super.  Bulgogi is standard.  Chicken wings are damn good - way better than San Tung (don't understand the buzz about San Tung, I think their food sucks).  Small small small, not good for groups.  Seems cleaner than the rest of the inner sunset dumps, but i've not been privy to view the kitchen!
author: david l.

description: They clearly need to hire more help for busy weekends! Went back last friday night and service was awful. Waited half hour to get our food, waited half hour for our check, etc. etc. Food was still good but people around us were clearly getting exasperated. Once they work their kinks out I am sure it will be fine, but for now I will only be coming here on weekday nights or during off hours.
author: Violet C.

description: The Dae Ji Bulgogi (spicy bbq pork) is about as good as the "grill at your table" places in inner sunset and half the price. Place is small so it's sometimes hard to get a table but takeout is great option. They should probably get a website though...
author: Andrew T.

description: Me and my friend barely made it before tet were going to close after lunch, but they still welcomed us warmly and the service was really good! Kept on bringing side dishes for us the moment it was gone. Food was good too. It's in a easy location so go if you're in the area!!
author: Keisuke H.

description: Having a Korean food craving?? This def hits the spot.  I am so used to getting a ton of banchan (spoiled by NYC K-Town) so would have liked to have gotten a little more diversity, BUT the food can def hold its own against the best Korean places. Got the hot stone bibim bap, spicy noodles, japchae and their sweet and soy chicken wings...all delicious!!! Service was so welcoming and attentive.  Will def be back soon and be a regular!
author: Candace D.

description: This place is amazing during lunch hours. Its affordable compared to other Korean restaurants in San Francisco. The bibimbap in clay pot was good. Very friendly and have nice service. I notice they don't really serve the beef soup during lunch hours. Been there a few times, always said they don't have it. Instead asked us to purchase the one that's not on the lunch hour special.
author: Terence F.

description: Best korean restaurant in Inner Sunset, good lunch prices, amazing amazing service.
author: Eunice K.

description: This place was just awesome. The Kimchee Rice was glorious. I could eat there every day.
author: Claire W.

description: Phenomenal food, fantastic price, and great ownership.  Best Korean restaurant in the Sunset, and dollar-for-dollar, one of the best restaurants in the area.
author: Alex B.

description: my boyfriend didn't like the service, but i felt that they were really nice people who were just busy that night. the food was sososo good for a really great price. i would expect korean food to be pricier. we got the bibimbop and tofu soup (number nine and twelve). super delicious with no charge for extra sides. a really great restaurant in my opinion. i will definitely be coming again.
author: Vanessa Y.

description: Still the best.  Simple, no-nonsense, wholesome and delicious Korean fare.  There is pride here and the owner and staff are happy to see you happy.
author: Richard F.

description: The service is genuinely friendly. The food is made with fresh ingredients and served promptly. The prices make this restaurant a good deal.
author: Sargeant T.

description: Big portions. Packed with Korean kids, which is obviously a good sign. If there's a long wait (a possibility) they'll call you while you wait across the street at the bar, which is a plus. Banchan was decent but not enough pickles. Go with the kalbi and skip the spicy pork.
author: Brian C.

description:
So I was searching "korean" on yelp one day because i just came back from a trip to korea this summer and i started yearning the soup I fell in love with over there. Unless I'm in korea or LA I try to avoid eating too much korean food in San Francisco as Korean food is often associated with vocaburarly like "pricey" or "expensive".Bi-ssa yo. hehe  To my surprise I find Manna which just opened up recently. I didn't know until my sister checked this place out but Manna bought out the same location a thai restaurant used to be. I was ecstatic to find out a new korean restaurant opened up in the Sunset. What caught my attention mostly was the rating on the payscale. Only one "$"! Do you know how rare that is to see that attached to a korean restaurant in SF? 

So I finally check this place out with family on a Sunday evening. There was 5 of us. The place is packed when we arrive. AFter a short wait of like 5 minutes we were quickly seated. Our waitress a slightly elderly women served us and was very friendly. Despite the amount of tables she had to manage by herself she still promptly took our orders and came back shortly with water and tea. The wait for food was not that long maybe like 10 minutes. When the food arrived it came at quick succession one after the other. Our table even though quite large was barely able to accommodate 5 large dishes plus the appetizers they give you for free. From the top of my head we orderd dolsat seafood bibimbap, pajeon(seafood pancake), japchae, beef stew, and something else. I forgot the last dish but the most memorable food to me was the japchae. It has the perfect amount of oil and the noodles were probably the best I've eaten in SF. Portions were decently large and by the end of dinner we were all stuff. The total bill came out to $50. Not bad for 5 dishes and appetizers.

I definitely recommend this place if you are craving korean food and want to save some moolah. Manna is a welcomed addition to the sunset and a refreshing beginning to good affordable korean food.
author: Jude N.

description: love the sweet and spicy wings and short ribs. the place is small, don't go with big group.
author: Gina L.

description: Solid food, good banchan, and always very friendly service. You can't beat the value per dollar Manna provides for Korean food in SF, especially for their lunch specials.
author: Kai C.

description: We really enjoyed the food at this restaurant The dol-sot bibimbab and barbque chicken were very good. The yam clear noodles were delicious. The prices are really reasonable . We paid $38 for 3 dishes and a large beer.  The restaurant is small but very nice. Staff is pretty friendly. We'll definitely be back.
author: Olga S.

description: I got parking within a block (without circling or stalking, what?!).  That was already a good sign.  The place is tiny maybe 7 tables?  It's located on a corner with big wide windows and is extremely well lit at night.  I felt kind of self conscious eating because I'm sure people driving/passing by were looking in and can see and judge my eating habits haha.  I was extremely hungry and kept going back and forth.  I even thought about getting two meals, but then I looked up and saw the big windows and opt to get the seafood tofu soup only.  This is the first time I ever finished my entire soup bowl!!  I usually finish the seafood pretty quickly and get tired of the soup and the outrageous amount of tofu leftover, however this place passed the test.  I was extremely full though so I don't know if it's a good thing for me but it just shows how good their tofu soup is.  The only thing I have to complain about is WHERE IS THE EGG??  My favorite part is cracking the egg and eating the semi raw yolk.  (I'm a huge egg lover so I was extremely sad and disappointed.)  Other than the missing egg it was delicious.  Their side dishes are also great.  And I must commend them for their customer service.  I think it was only a couple serving and they were so quick and attentive.  I asked for water and bc it took a while, I assumed the guy forgot, however he came with a beautiful glass of water soon after that thought.  Even my friend said "Oh! He remembered!!"   Great great job.  I'll definitely be back because the two guys sitting next to me got kalbi and now I want it!
author: Tammy N.

description: It's nice to finally have a Korean place in the neighborhood.  2 things in particular make Manna winner for me.  One, the prices.  Everything is super reasonably priced (entrees under $10 and $5 for a large Korean beer).  It's great to have the option to go to a Korean restaurant and spend less than $20 per person for food you don't have to cook yourself.  Sometimes that's ok but it's nice to have another option.  Second reason Manna is a winner is:  I LIKE THEIR KIMCHEE.  I don't care if it's "authentic" or not.  I've been trying kimchee everywhere it's served thinking I'll like it eventually but never do.  Until Manna.  I still don't love it and I don't know why I feel the need to like it but that's not really important.  Probably because it's such a Korean staple.  They only serve about 6 side dishes but this was the first time I have actually liked ALL of them, including the kimchee.  My seafood soft tofu soup totally hit the spot on a foggy summer SF night.  Service is also extremely friendly.
author: M M.

description: Great Mom and Pop eatery. Everything looks good and priced right. Nice staff. Worth waiting in line for and looking for a parking spot !  My wife ordered a chicken dish but it did not look as tasty as the beef dishes I spotted on other tables.
author: Don S.

description: The food here is clean, fresh, and reasonably priced.  I am a fan of the Vegetable Dolsot Bibimbop- mmm soo good. I think the bulgogi has good flavor, but I find the meat to be too fatty here. The chicken wings are damn good, and the service is great.  The restaurant is extremely small. You could go here in a super casual date, or with a friend, but I wouldnt recommend more than 4 people at a time.
author: N A.

description: I split the sweet and spicy wings and kimchi fried rice. Both were delicious, the wings were really spectacular. The entrees were very reasonable priced, generally $8-12. The complementary Korean side dishes and tea were tasty and got refilled several times. The staff was very nice and quick, great service. We didn't have reservations and sat immediately, but it was a small party and late. I'll be back for sure.
author: Cameron B.

description: I LOOOOOVVEEE THIS PLACE! I just wish they delivered! the waiter/waitress (who are always there..makes me think its family owned which is a plus!) are really really nice and their food is delicious ! I always get spicy bbq pork and yam noodles and which are hella good, last time we were here my bf got ribs nd loved them. Also love the kimchi pancake and bi bim bap
author: Aisha F.

description: Kimchi fried rice sucked. It was sweet. So weird. The kimchi jigae soup was super good. But the pork inside was ground pork. Really dry and bad! Service is great tho!
author: Cindy L.

description: My wife and I hooked up with friends at Manna.  The place was packed, but we only stood on the street for 10 minutes.  The service was very quick and the food was wonderful, and prices were low. A very good combo.   We will be back.
author: John H.

description: This place will most definitely be a regular for us! Though I won't even try to write the names of the dishes we enjoyed and I can't remember their numbers but I do know everything was great. We had the dumpling soup which I am craving for more. I wish the plates (to eat off) were bigger to house more food since the portions are perfect. 4 of us got out of there for under $50.
author: William S.

description: Great service, great atmosphere, great food. How much better can it get? Whenever I go there, I order the Kalbi Beef short ribs. It is soooo juicy and super delicious. Well only one more thing to say...... GO TO MANNA!!!!!!! :D
author: Ben L.

description: This is not a place for those who like Americanized Korean food.  This is straight up excellent Korean food.  I am a Korean, so I have had plenty of Korean food.  I have had several dishes here including daenjang chigae, soon dooboo soup, and the dol sot bi bim bap.  The soups are the tastiest I have had in a long time.  The prices are good for Korean food, and the service is excellent.  Carry out is also very well done and well packaged.  Don't be fooled by the small place or the humble owners...this is the best Korean food in SF right now.  If you want to grill on charcoal, go to Brother's.  Korean Burritos, go to John's Deli.  Everything else, go to Manna.
author: Sam V.

description: Favorite Korean restaurant in the city. I have yet to be served anything I didn't like, although the dol sot bap is so good I usually just order that.
author: Chuck J.

description: food is good, but the delivery of dishes left much to be desired.  I guess since they're new, they need a little time on getting their flow going.  I got the last of my 3 dishes when I was done eating the first 2.  we were a table of 3 eating family style.
author: Irv C.

description: really affordable. bibimbap and pancake were pretty good. the workers were so nice! unlike other korean restaurants ive been to, they were happy to serve us banchan refills!
author: Tiff C.
